column1: Tarlang was a legendary Giants.J.R.R. Tolkien
column2: Guide to the Names in The Lord of the Rings
column3: omitted entry quoted in Wayne G. Hammond
column5: The Lord of the Rings: A Readers Companion

column2: Tarlang belonged to a group of giants who in "ancient days" were building the White Mountains in order to prevent Men from entering the giants land close by the Beleriand. While carrying a heavy load of rocks
column3: Tarlang stumbled and fell on his face
column4: fatally breaking his neck. His corpse was used by the other giants to finish the wall: his remants formed the pass Tarlangs Neck (from the break in his neck)
column6: and Cûl Veleg and Cûl Bîn (remnants of his load of rocks).

column1: The name Tarlang is glossed as "stiff neck"
